General Information

Full Name Harun Ardiansyah
Languages Indonesian (native), English (professional)
Summary Harun is a PhD student at the Department of Nuclear, Plasma, and Radiological Engineering at University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign (UIUC) specialized in nuclear reactor physics and analysis. He is part of Analysis of Reactor Transient and Stability (ARTS) group at UIUC supervised by Prof. Tomasz Kozlowski. Along the years, he has involved in some projects related to nuclear reactor physics of advanced reactor, high-performance computing, analysis and method development. In his PhD research, he focuses on power reactor diagnostics and noise analysis for advanced reactor application. Aside his academic pursuit, he is also involved in energy policy activism in his home country of Indonesia. He is currently building a nuclear technology think-tank “Siwabessy Initiative” with his partners.

Formal education

  • current
    PhD in Nuclear, Plasma, and Radiological Engineering
    University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign (UIUC)
    Analysis of Reactor Transients and Stability (ARTS)
    Codes, Transients, Noises
  • 2021
    Master's Degree in Nuclear Engineering and Radiological Sciences
    University of Michigan (UMich)
    Nuclear Reactor Analysis and Methods (NURAM)
    Evaluation of PBMR-400 Core Design Steady State Condition with Serpent and AGREE.
  • 2018
    Bachelor's Degree in Nuclear Engineering
    Universitas Gadjah Mada (UGM)
    Nuclear Engineering and Engineering Physics (DNEEP)
    Core Design Parametric Study of Integral Pressurized Water Reactor (IPWR) with Mixed Oxide Ceramic Fuel using SRAC Code System

Research experience

  • Aug 2021 - Now
    Graduate Student Research Assistant
    University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign (UIUC)
    Analysis of Reactor Transients and Stability (ARTS)
    • Research topic: Neutron diffusion code development, power reactor noise analysis for advanced reactors, safety analysis of advanced reactors (Molten Salt Reactors and High Temperature Gas-cooled Reactors)
    • Advisor: Prof. Tomasz Kozlowski
  • Nov 2019 - Aug 2021
    Graduate Student Research Assistant
    University of Michigan (UMich)
    Nuclear Reactor Analysis and Methods (NURAM)
    • Performed steady-state and transient analysis of PBMR-400 core design, validation and verification of HTR-10 with Serpent and AGREE.
    • Advisors and Mentors: Prof. Thomas Downar, Dr. Volkan Seker
  • Jun 2018 - Dec 2018
    Research Intern
    P.T. Energi Sterilia Higiena (Indonesia)
    • Conducted and made reports of neutronics modeling and simulation of Thorium Generator 3 kWe.
    • Mentor: Dr. Andang Widi Harto.
  • Jan 2017 - Feb 2017
    Research Intern
    Center of Nuclear Fuel Technology, National Nuclear Energy Agency of Indonesia
    • Conducted research on Cesium separation using cation exchange method
    • Mentor: Ir. Rosika Kriswarini

Teaching/Mentoring experience

  • Mar 2017 - May 2018
    Laboratory Assistant
    Universitas Gadjah Mada (UGM)
    Nuclear Engineering and Engineering Physics (DNEEP)
    • Course: Radiation Detection and Measurement Laboratory Works.
    • Assisted lab works on multichannel analyzer, prepared lab syllabus, handouts, pre-tests, and exams for 60 sophomores nuclear engineering students.
  • Aug 2016 - Dec 2016
    Lecturer Assistant
    Universitas Gadjah Mada (UGM)
    Nuclear Engineering and Engineering Physics (DNEEP)
    • Course: Introduction to Nuclear Technology.
    • Gave substitute lectures and review/discussion sessions, held office hours, and prepared supplemental materials for ~60 sophomores nuclear engineering students.
    • Primary Instructor/Lecturer: Ir. Mondjo, M.T.
